bug.author: bashi-bazouk
bug.summary: tf.tensordot documentation describes non-existent `a_axes` and `b_axes` parameters
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/tensordot>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/tensordot</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
There are no a_axes and b_axes parameters, but the documentation describes the function as if there are.

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/bashi-bazouk>@bashi-bazouk</denchmark-link>
In the function tf.tensordot( a, b, axes, name=None) axes parameter means a-axis , b-axis parameters. For eg: means and For more details refer <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/tensordot#args>this link</denchmark-link> . Thanks!
Maybe you should make the documentation say that instead of the github issue.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/bashi-bazouk>@bashi-bazouk</denchmark-link>
The above information is available in the <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/tensordot#args>documentation.</denchmark-link> .Please, let me know if you have any questions.Thanks!

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ravikyram>@ravikyram</denchmark-link> There is no sentence in the documentation that says that axes parameter decomposes into a_axes and b_axes. The documentation simply starts referring to these arguments, as if they are self-evident. However, they're not, and the lack of that documentation is the reason that I created this issue. The link you provided points to the exact page that I said is lacking this documentation.
